inn1.comm: leans forward to nudge it back to the bowler
on the pads, flicked away but straight to square-leg
stretches well forward to defend to the off
on the middle stump line, worked to wide mid-on for a quiet single
flighted up on the leg stump line, McCullum plays for the turn but there is none and it hits the pad
tossed up full on the middle and off, squirted out to mid-on for a single
not much swing first ball, batsman gets forward and carves it through cover, not particularly well-timed, enough time to get three
length ball slanting into the pads, nudged towards square leg
nice line from Steyn, just outside off, on a good length, batsman shoulders arms
the trademark away movement from Steyn makes it appearance, the ball starts too far outside off though to worry the batsman
that one was 139.2kmh, but still bounced a second time before reaching the keeper, not much in this pitch for fast bowlers it seems
makes the batsman play this time, gets it close to off, blocked towards cover by Guptill

stunning catch from Peterson, that's the end of McCullum, massive wicket this, a tossed up delivery short of a length, McCullum came charging out, didn't reach the pitch, so he looked to block that, it pops up towards Peterson's left, and the bowler launches himself and plucks it to get his 15th wicket of the World Cup
defend towards the off side
stays in the crease and blocks it towards point
length ball just outside off, watchfully played back towards the bowler
tossed up by Peterson, pushed back to the bowler
no maiden for Peterson, slides this onto the pads, Ryder tucks it towards midwicket to get off the mark
a superb diving stop from JP Duminy at backward point causes a mix-up, there's enough time for both batsman to get home in time though, it was a full toss that Ryder slapped towards Duminy
on the pads and Ryder defends
that would have been a great ball to a right-hander, isn't so great to the left-hander, a wide down the leg side
Ryder survives, just about, a french cut gets him a boundary, a short of length ball that comes into the batsman, who looks to drive without any footwork, takes a thick inside-edge
back of a length and on the pads again, tucked towards square leg
Ryder pulls out a big shot as soon as Steyn pitches it a touch short, he can't time it all as he goes for the pull, it clears mid-on and Tahir has a long chase ahead of him
outside off, and an easy leave for Guptill
stifled appeal for lbw, a fullish ball pitching on middle, inside-edged onto the pad
outside off this time, Ryder goes for the cut, gets a bottom-edge towards point
length ball outside off, pushed towards cover
Ryder is having a lot of trouble here, a quicker one catches Ryder on the backfoot, bottom-edged to the pads
gets well forward and blocks it
a bit of width this time, Ryder can't time the ball as he drives towards mid-off, gets the single to keep strike
full and wide outside off, Ryder throws his bat at it, doesn't connect and the keeper collects on the second bounce
outside off and tentative stuff from Ryder, he pokes at it and the outside edge flies past first slip, down to third man, and Ryder is off strike
length ball angling into middle, defended back to the bowler off the front foot
short of length and outside off, punched off the back foot towards the off side, another dot ball
the South Africans are throwing themselves about in the field, an acrobatic dive at short cover stops a punch from Guptill

slower one from Steyn does the job, Guptill is gone, it is a full delivery at 121kmh, at least 20k less than normal pace, Guptill looks to clear mid-off, bottom hand comes off the bat as he plays the stroke, it balloons over Botha, who has to run back to pouch it, South Africa have been spot-on so far today
length ball outside off, defended off the front foot
another forward defence from Taylor
the ball is coming really slowly on to the bat, Taylor waits on the back foot and taps the ball towards midwicket to get off the mark
length ball outside off, Ryder blocks off the front foot
a muted appeal for lbw, as Ryder defends, it was a straight ball that was going down leg
once more a delivery that is heading down leg, Ryder plays down the wrong line and is hit on the pad
he hits the spot straightaway, back of a length and outside off, defended
length ball outside off, bit of an outside edge that goes to third man
slants this down the leg side, should have been put away for four, Ryder doesn't get bat on it though
overpitched outside off, and that's the best shot of the day, smashed through cover for four, that was too full from Morkel and Ryder capitalises
Morkel reverts to his good length, blocked by Ryder
a touch shorter from Morkel, Ryder stands tall and punches the ball past extra cover, not too well timed but gets enough on it to get a couple
Taylor waits an eternity on the backfoot for the ball to arrive, pushed towards mid-on
again gets on the back foot and tucks the ball to the leg side, this time between mid-on and midwicket
length ball on middle and heading towards leg with the angle, blocked towards the leg side
that's a wide down the leg side, de Villiers moves across quickly to collect
fullish ball on the stumps, defended towards the off side
solidly defended off the front foot by Ross Taylor
a hint of width, Taylor goes back and slashes the ball towards backward point, doesn't beat the fielder
length ball outside off, defended off the back foot towards point
on the pads this time from Morkel, Ryder goes back in the crease and pushes the ball towards mid-on
just a bit of width, and Ryder hammers that past Kallis at point, it was very close to the fielder but it had too much power on it for Kallis to stop it, Kallis was looking at self-preservation there

another confident hit from Ryder, he seems at ease when the ball is pitched up as Morkel has done now, he lashes it towards extra cover, but gets no reward for the stroke as Steyn flings himself to his right to cut that off
short of length from Morkel, defended off the back foot

similar length, but one the legstump this time, Ryder plays a flamboyant pull, raising his front leg as he plays that stroke, the timing isn't perfect and the outfield isn't too quick due to yesterday's rain, Amla races across from deep backward square leg and puts in a dive to save his team one run
length ball is defended towards cover
on the pads, tucked towards midwicket by Ryder
short of length ball outside off, defended cautiously off the front foot
on offstump, Taylor shuffles across and clips the ball just behind square leg
length ball angling into middle, blocked back towards the bowler
well outside off, driven towards extra cover
on middle stump, nudged towards square leg
speared down the leg side, Taylor looks to work the ball fine, can't get bat on it but it brushes the pas and goes to fine leg
Taylor hasn't tried anything expansive yet though it is the Powerplay, a fullish ball on middle and leg is worked towards midwicket

just as Mark Nicholas says Peterson can't bowl wide outside off since there is no one in the deep on the off side, Peterson bowled it wide outside off, Ryder capitalises, goes back and cracks the ball in front of point
fullish ball on the pads, defended to the bowler

Peterson again gives width, again he is punished, Ryder gets back and slaps that powerfully between point and cover, Amla gives chase and puts in another of his dives but can't stop the ball this time
Taylor stands tall and punches the ball down the ground, Tahir dives and gets a hand on that straight drive
a ripping googly from Tahir, bounces sharply as well, Ryder had no clue about that, the ball spins across outside off, beating Ryder's bat
this one stays a bit low, on the pads, pushed towards mid-on
length ball on middle and leg that goes more or less straight on, tucked by Taylor towards the leg side
length ball pitching outside leg, Taylor moves across and clips the ball towards square leg for a single that brings up the 50
another slider from Tahir to end the over, Ryder searches for that one outside off but doesn't connect
defended watchfully off the front foot towards the leg side
length ball on middle and off, Taylor charges down the ground and works the ball towards mid-on and wants a single, Ryuder doesn't so there's no run
length ball on the pads, worked towards midwicket for a single
length ball on the pads, Ryder defends towards the leg side
similar delivery, Ryder goes back this time and taps the ball to square leg for a single
length ball angling in, Taylor eases the ball towards mid-on off the front foot
fullish ball on middle and off, Taylor moves across and glances the ball towards fine leg
fuller and down the leg side, worked towards square leg, a diving JP Duminy can't cut off the single
full and outside off, punched towards mid-off by Ryder
full and just outside off, played towards extra cover by Ryder
fullish ball on off, blocked off the front foot
overpitched outside leg stump, Taylor gets a leading edge leading to much excitement among the South Africans, but the ball loops towards a vacant short cover and Taylor survives
he starts with a short and wide ball, that's easy for Ryder, he thrashes that towards point, where JP Duminy saves four with a stunning dive
another leading edge, on the pads this time and Ryder was looking to turn the ball towards the leg side, edges it to the right of the bowler
short and Ryder stands tall before punching it to cover point
on the pads again, defended by Ryder
short of length ball on middle and leg, defended by Ryder off the back foot
Morkel sticks to the middle and leg line, worked by Ryder towards square leg
full ball is punched by Ryder towards cover
Ryder pushes it down the wicket, the bowler can't stop it and they take a single
Taylor clips it to short midwicket, a direct hit from the fielder ricochets towards extra cover and gives away a single
Ryder gets well forward to block this one
on a length and just outside off, defended off the front foot by Ryder
this time it is Faf du Plessis who throws himself to his left to restrict the batsman to a single
back of a length and outside off, moved in a touch and Ryder inside-edges on to the pads
plenty of width on offer for Ryder, he likes it there, slaps that through cover but can't get it all the way to the boundary
an ungainly pull from Ryder sends the ball towards square leg
short of length ball angling down leg, Taylor shuffles across and gets the ball away towards square leg
short ball outside leg, easy pickings for Ryder, helps the ball past the keeper to fine leg for four, Morkel hasn't been at his best today, usually such a tight bowler
short of length ball on offstump, blocked off the back foot by Ryder
turn and bounce, slow loopy ball on off breaking in, Taylor doesn't offer a shot. Pops away off the thigh pad.
flight outside off, this one holds its line as Taylor defends

top shot. Taylor pushes the front foot forward to the pitch of Botha's flighted offie, meets it on the bounce and sends it purring through the covers. Played it into the ground, and found the gap to a nicety.
holds it back a touch and turns it into the pads, Taylor works with the spin to midwicket
back of a length and turning away from Ryder who pushes off the back foot into the covers for a single
nice shot for no runs. 82 kph, tossed up outside off and turning in, Taylor looks to run it fine, but finds short third man
tight line, back of a length and angling from middle to off, Ryder stays back and guides to third man for one
slants in from off and middle, Taylor looks to nurdle along to fine leg but it slides off the pad to the keeper
no width outside off, but Taylor looks to power the cut away. He makes decent contact with it, but can't place it past point
the Kallis bouncer is the very epitome of a heavy ball. 137 kph, thudded into the turf with that open-chested action, putting the whole body into it. Taylor ducks under safely
another one on off, Taylor tries to steer away and finds point
Taylor finally gets that hacked back foot chop away, past point for a single
tossed up outside off, Taylor pushes forward and gets a single into the covers
flighted outside off, Ryder is readily forward and angles the face to guide towards point
similar ball, similar shot. Ryder still can't get it past point
straighter this time, curving in from wide of the crease as Ryder plays it to mid off
mid off drops back for the last two balls, Ryder gets the single by forcing a back of a length ball on off stump towards long on
Ryder leans inside the line of a flighted offie coming in with the angle and works it to midwicket for a single
back of a length and finishing on Taylor's pads, he taps it to midwicket
aha, canny offcutter at 129 kph, Taylor doesn't pick it as it nips in and fends from the crease. Inside edge pops between bat and pad, close to leg stump
a touch of width outside off, Taylor waits and dabs it late it down to third man for a single
Ryder has 50. I am backing him for a 100 today. Another offcutter, finishes on middle stump and Ryder quietly pushes into the covers for a single.

Kallis bouncer outside off, Taylor tries in vain to climb over it and pull it into the turf. He manages to get it away for a single into the leg side. 3000 ODI runs for Taylor. One-sixth of a Tendulkar.

oho, Ryder almost undid my prophecy there, going for a compulsive pull to a well-directed bouncer on middle and off. Not quite short enough, and he gets a top edge that balloons alarmingly to the left of the keeper and dribbles away to short third man.
Ryder gets a single, leaning far out to the flight and driving Botha with the spin to long off
short of a length on off and breaking in, Taylor defends from the crease to the leg side
a bit of a leading edge as Taylor closes the bat a touch early. It runs back down the track to the bowler.
too straight, on the pads and turned away square, but he can't get the single yet.
fired in full and fast on middle, Taylor whips through mid on for a single
Ryder is in milk mode. And no, this is not some joke about his rinking habits. Back of a length outside off, he expertly guides it between Botha and short cover for another single.
short of a length on off stump, Kallis keeps it tight and Ryder politely defends from the crease.
a half a foot outside off, Ryder opens the face as he punches from the crease and finds cover
smart and slow bouncer, Ryder didn't see the drop in pace and eventually just weaved away from the line
another dot ball, Kallis is giving Ryder nothing to drive. He stays back and pushes straight to midwicket
Kallis, canny as ever. Now he slips in the fullish offcutter, gently angling away and begging for the outside edge. Ryder is stuck in the crease as he forces it off the outside half to point.
maiden from Kallis. Ryder gets a leg bye as he tries to nudge off the pads
not as full as he would want, outside off, and Ryder thwacks a cut to the deep for a single
full on middle and off, Taylor gets inside the line takes it on the full and flicks through midwicket
holds it back and keeps it straight, Taylor plays it back at the bowler
fired in at 95 kph on the pads, Taylor turns it away square and gets the single

clever little chip from Ryder. JP doesn't toss it all the way up, Ryder gets forward looking for the drive, but sees he's not quite there. He goes through with the loft, with the spin over extra cover for a couple.
faster and straighter, Ryder covers the line and defends
inducker at 131 kph from outside off to start off, Taylor dabs it with the angle through backward square leg for a single
aha, rapped on the pads as Ryder is stuck on the back foot and plays the flick an instant too late. Landed outside leg, and hit him further away though.
angling across at 133 kph, Ryder is still on the back foot as he taps into the off side.
he's cranking it up slowly. 140 kph on that full length ball that was looking for the pad or the timber. Ryder whipped the wrists at the last moment and played it to midwicket
another dot, Ryder reaches out to a length ball and works it straight to midewicket
the runs have dried up. Steyn finishes with another tight ball, angling across from off stump, and Ryder plays it from the crease to the off side.
speared in on middle and leg, Taylor turns it away square for another single
wide delivery, straying well down the leg side and called.
speared in on the pads, Ryder blocks it to the leg side for a pinched single
Taylor leans out to a flighted ball well outside off and looks to play the late steer, but can't beat short third man
fired in on the pads, Taylor on-drives off the front foot for another single. Vintage tuk-tuk cricket.
dropped short on this occasion, but no width for Ryder to cut and he forces it straight to deep cover.
flat and fired outside off, Taylor looks to dab and gets an under-edge to short third man.

Ryder's produced a fine boundary out of nowhere. 145 kph length ball on middle and angling across, Ryder gets half forward and whacks the off drive, through the line and past mid off. Fine shot, went back at double the pace it came at. The crowd's woken up, says Pat Symcox on air.
fuller from Steyn just short of a yorker, and Ryder defends to the leg side
length ball on the the stumps, Ryder covers the line and defends from the crease
another smart shot, just using Steyn's pace. We saw Raina do that a lot against Tait and Lee yesterday. Full and on the pads, Ryder chips inside the line and flicks backward of square for two.
looked like a slower ball to me, but the speed gun says that was at 141 kph. Full and on middle, Ryder was clearly early on the defence, and then adjusted to keep it out.
back of a length outside off, Ryder hops onto the back foot and defends towards point
loopy ball on leg stump, Taylor leans out and eases it off the pads to midwicket
shortens the length and gets some more turn from leg stump, Taylor nurdles against the spin through backward square leg for one
leggie breaks in from outside off, Ryder stays back and works it with the spin to midwicket
this one hurries through outside off, Ryder plays it back down the track
Ryder gets well forward on off stump to get to the flight and eases the drive through extra cover for a single
nicely done by Taylor, waiting for the leggie to straighten and come onto the pads before turning the wrists with soft hands. Couple more to the total before square leg can clean up.

things aren't working for SA. Ryder is cashing in for having played some very sensible cricket thus far. Robin tosses this up well outside off, Ryder comes charging out, making room as he does and then carves inside out, against the spin, almost all the way over extra cover. This is super smart cricket, another boundary off the over's first ball.
shortens the length, Ryder hangs back and nudges into midwicket for a single
flat again to Taylor, who does the wise single by bunting a single through mid on
Ryder continues to chip along. Loopy ball on his toes, he taps it gently over the infield through midwicket for one
Taylor tries to steal a single after defending a delivery on off stump, so softly that it goes no where.
these two have added 100. Taylor gets a full ball on the pads and forces it to long on for one more. South Africa are sweating now.
good old Taylor slog sweep. Tahir lands this well outside leg and turns it in, Taylor connects with thin air and it hits the pad.
leggie on leg stump, extra bounce and Taylor is opened up as he defends
another leggie on middle and off, defended into the off side
fired in on a length outside off, Taylor picks the variation and angles it backward of point for one

aha, Ryder gets away with a mis-hit. Tahir tosses up a dolly well outside off, Ryder looks to crack the cut over point, and doesn't middle it. The outside edge spirals out of control but eludes point easily.
aha, ripping wrong 'un that gets big on Taylor, who clearly didn't pick it as he played back, and ended up fending uncertainly to the off side
loopy delivery on middle and leg, Ryder drives firmly to long on for a single

Taylor has taken off. He's just put the slog in slog-sweep. He's just put the power in power-hitting. He's whacked the leather off that ball. Peterson won't flight it too much any more. This was tossed up on the pads, Taylor got the front foot outside the line and just went after it with a fury. The ball hardly went high, but it sure went far.
another power blow through midwicket, this time he is too close to the pitch and ends up getting a single over mid on.
its terror from Taylor, and touch from Ryder. He just leans out to the pitch and dinks calmly over the cover fielder for two more.
slower through the air, Ryder plays defensively
fires in the armer to end the over, Ryder stays on the crease and plays it out to the off side.
Taylor has truly turned on slog sweep mode. Anything on middle or leg will go. Tahir tosses this outside leg, and Taylor cracks it along the ground to deep square leg
googly, but dropped too wide outside off, Ryder looked to cut but missed it as it turned too much away from him
this one straightens outside off and Ryder punches from the crease into the off side for a single
flighted outside off, Taylor looks to dab a single through cover point, but can't get him away
faster, 97 kph on off stump and very full, Taylor plays it back to the bowler

big moment. Huge moment. The moment that could turn this match. Tahir has been hustling through his overs, in an attempt to catch Taylor out of breath, before this ball Taylor stopped him by walking down the pitch for some gardening. However, he has perished off the next ball, going for another one of those whip-lashed slog sweeps. It was flighted on leg stump, very full and hence not quite offering him the room to get under it. Taylor ended up launching it high over deep square leg, and when it came down, the greatest allrounder in the game was under it.
Peterson to continue, defended off the front foot
on the pads, whipped off the back foot towards midwicket
fullish ball just outside off, driven back past the bowler
length ball outside off, Styris gets well forward and pushes the ball uppishly towards short cover
full ball on off, driven along the ground to long-on for a single
short of length ball outside off, played off the back foot to short cover
full and flighted outside off, driven to mid-off
length ball on off, driven fluently towards wide mid-on by Styris
turns in towards legstump, Ryder looks to clip that one to the leg side, but inside-edges on to the pad
shuffles across and taps this towards midwicket
defended towards the bowler
length ball outside off, dabbed towards the off side
a lovely shot from Styris, it was a short of length ball, hit on the up past the bowler, wonderful timing that, mid-on could only watch
a touch shorter from Morkel, on off, ball hits the splice of the bat as Styris defends
length ball this time and confidently driven along the ground to mid-off by Styris, who has looked good in his short stay
short ball, only 128kmh from Morkel, Styris seemed to be early on to the pull, not too well timed but gets enough on it to send it to the midwicket boundary, 11 off 9 now Styris
short of length ball and into middle, driven towards the leg side by Styris
'Nooo,' shouts Styris after dabbing the ball towards backward point
makes some room and drives a fullish ball inside out towards mid-off
Styris has come out with an attacking mindset, he charges out of the ground and lashes that ball to the long-on boundary for four more
defended back towards the bowler
a bit of width, Styris cuts that towards backward point
on the pads this time, worked towards midwicket by Styris for a single
length ball on off to end the over, watchfully defended off the front foot by Ryder
length ball on middle, Styris tucks that one towards the leg side from the crease

Morne has struck, Styris was looking to give himself room and whack that over the off side, he gets a bottom-edge to that short ball and the ball cannons on to the stumps, New Zealand have lost their fourth, Morne redeems what has been an ordinary bowling effort from him so far
short of length and well outside off, Williamson lets it go
length ball slanting towards leg, whipped towards square leg by Williamson to get off the mark
short of length ball on the pads, pushed towards mid-on by Ryder, who plays that shot from the crease
again minimal footwork from Ryder as he tries to work a legstump delivery from Morkel, he can't get it away, and that's exactly the over South Africa needed from Morkel
the googly spins a long way down the leg side
flighted delivery from Tahir, on a length and just outside off, defended off the front foot
Williamson playing a bit tentatively, defends that legspinner under his eyes
slips in a quick googly, Williamson manages to get that away towards square leg for a single
Ryder punches this ball back towards Tahir

Ryder holes out, Tahir has got another big wicket, all that time building a platform has gone waste as Ryder swings this one to deep midwicket, Colin Ingram is waiting for that, he pouches it easily, and New Zealand have lost their fifth, the late onslaught New Zealand were hoping for could now become a more measured attempt to play out the full 50 overs
Williamson sweeps that one behind square leg for a single
short of length ball outside off, the trademark Morkel delivery, defended towards the off side
slants this one into middle, fuller delivery, Williamson works it to square leg
short and wide, Williamson jumps and scythes that towards sweeper cover, not too well timed that
drops short of first slip, it was a short of length ball outside off, 143kmh, not sure why Williamson wanted to play that off the front foot, a thick edge lands well short
length ball just outside off, shuffles across and plays a wristy shot that sends the ball scurrying wide of midwicket
length ball even wide outside off, Williamson moves across a long way and shows off another wristy shot, this one is quite well timed and goes nearly all the way to the midwicket boundary
flighted and full, on middle and off, driven along the ground to the left of the diving bowler
full toss is punched past the bowler, it was in the air but wide enough to the right of the bowler to be safe
full ball and pretty wide, McCullum gets down on one knee and carves that to sweeper cover
keeps it full, just outside off, a safe drive to long-off for a single
googly from Tahir, McCullum looks to defend and gets an inside-edge towards square leg
fired in on offstump, full ball, defended off the front foot

terrific stuff from AB, a length ball from Steyn, on off, batsman opens the face to guide it past the keeper, AB flies across to stop that and nearly throws down the stumps though he still had the gloves on
batsman makes room again and gets an edge, that lands a foot in front of the keeper, who can't reach it even though he moves forward to collect
length ball on offstump, McCullum opens the face once more and guides the ball towards point
fires in the bouncer, 143.7kmh, Williamson ducks, just one off the over so far
wants to tip the ball towards short cover and set off for the single, McCullum sends him back, superb over from Steyn that
full ball on middle and off, defended towards the bowler
fired into the pads, gets a leading edge that lands safely on the pitch
not much flight now from Peterson, pushed towards point
length ball on the pad, tucked towards midwicket for a single
length ball homing in on legstump, punched back to the bowler
Williamson makes room and carves the ball from middle stump towards sweeper cover for a single, just two off this over, a far cry from the blitz NZ were hoping for towards the end
short of length ball pitching on middle, pushed past a diving midwicket fielder for a single
short of length on the pads, tucked towards square leg
short of length again from Steyn, on middle and off, McCullum again shuffles across the stumps and tucks the ball to the leg side for a single
swing and a miss outside off
bouncer outside off, McCullum waves his bat at it but can't connect, another dot ball
full slower ball, on legstump, defended towards the leg side, another quiet over comes to an end
flighted and full, on middle stump, punched back to the bowler
Williamson sends a message to the baiters, comes out of the crease and a clean hit sends the ball soaring beyond long-on for six, nicely done
skips beyond leg and pushes the ball towards mid-off for a single

McCullum moves across the stumps then moves back, Peterson fires the ball down leg, an almighty swipe from McCullum connects only with air, AB perhaps distracted by all the movement from the batsman can't collect that one
chipped towards mid-on, Williamson was sprinting the first, eyeing a second but he slipped so it's just one
length ball from Peterson, driven along the ground towards extra cover
Williamson shuffles across once more, and tucks a slower ball from Steyn towards mid-on
full ball outside off, McCullum moves beyond leg and tries to crack that through off, but that is too quick for him

McCullum is gone, once more he was looking to make room, he didn't get enough space to free his arms, still wanted to thrash that short ball from Steyn, it flies off the top-edges towards backward point where Duminy takes the catch
an ambitious shot attempted by Williamson, a bouncer on legstump, Williamson moves away and tries to uppercut the ball but can't connect
the slower offcutter from Steyn, just back of a length, whipped towards midwicket by Williamson
a yorker length ball outside off, jabbed towards the off side and quick single is pinched
Tahir starts with a length ball on middle, punched back to the bowler who dives to stop the ball
length ball outside off, pushed back to the bowler
Tahir keeps it tight, outside off, driven towards long-off for a single
length ball turning away from the left-hander, poked towards the off side off the front foot
Oram nearly falls over as he sweeps that one, spots the gap behind square on the leg side, and he gets a boundary for his effort
lashed down the ground to long-off, Botha hurtles across to stop the boundary
short of length ball, a typical whip from Williamson, gets him two to deep midwicket
mistimed by Williamson he makes room to carve that ball through off, it was slower from Steyn, and the ball rolls towards cover
a low full toss just outside off, Oram was backing away, and the hulking Oram couldn't get play that low delivery with a horizontal bat
length ball outside off, driven firmly towards long-on, Oram sprints back for the second
a yorker is pushed towards extra cover, a direct hit from du Plessis would have got rid of Williamson, he misses
superb bowling from Steyn, follows Oram who is as usual looking to make room, Oram gets into a tangle playing that one and can only scramble a leg-bye
length ball on off, Oram was thinking of sending it into orbit over long-on, he misses, Morkel hits the top of off, and that's the end of Oram's struggle
what a shot from Vettori, he shuffles across and squirts an offstump ball behind square leg for four
backed away and looked to force it through cover, but can't beat short cover
fullish ball from Morkel, punched past mid-off by Vettori, who was miles outside leg, Smith has to chase that one down
slower yorker from Morkel, 129 kmh, Vettori has been dancing around the crease in his short stay, this time he stays rooted, and he misses it, as it crashes into the bottom on middle and leg
length ball on middle and leg, Woodcock pushes the ball past mid-on to get off the mark
short of length and outside off, jabbed towards backward point and sets off for a suicidal single, would have been gone if there was a direct hit, du Plessis misses again
whoah! what on earth was that 'shot' from Williamson, it was a bouncer from Steyn, Williamson got down on his knee and waved his bat above his head, the attempted periscopic hit doesn't connect
lashes this length ball from outside off to deep midwicket for a couple
shortish ball from Steyn, Williamson backs away and crashes this one over extra cover, Smith and  Botha chase but in vain

low full toss outside off, outstanding bowling from Steyn, slightly comical batting from Williamson who was looking to make room before spotting the outside off ball, he loses his balance, and doesn't connect
a wide down the leg side, and they sneak a bye as the ball goes to the keeper as well

what a delivery to end the innings, a yorker on legstump, Woodcock just about gets his bat on it, squeezed towards the leg side, 221 doesn't look too threatening a target but NZ can at least console themselves with the knowledge that they are the first team to be not be bowled out by SA in this tournament

inn2.comm: flat, no turn as it hurries through on a length, Amla stays back and punches to mid off
Amla is away in trademark style, drilling a square drive fluently in front of point as Natha pitches well up
Amla at his best. Again Natha flights it well outside off, inviting the drive and Amla accepts the invitation. He leans across to the flight, gets to the pitch and coaxes it between point and cover.
holds the length back and Amla stays back to tuck it backward of square leg for one
drifts into Smith's pads from wide of the crease, not much turn as Smith closes the face and squeezes it clumsily backward of square leg

Amla might be out. In the freakiest possible manner. Short ball from Nathan from wide of the crease, lands back of a length and keeps low as Amla shapes to cut. Since the ball kept low, he ended up under-edging it, and it was headed straight into the turf. Brendon McCullum had no chance of catching it as it hurtled downwards, but it thudded into his foot and took off towards slip, where it was caught. New Zealand knew it immediately. Brendon in a bit of pain, but he won't mind that. At all.
flighted on middle and off, Smith leans out to defend.
drift onto middle and leg, Smith looks to heave across and gets it away to square leg
back of a length this time, and Smith works it away square.
keeps it back of a length on leg stump, Smith tucks it through backward square leg and runs across quickly for two to beat the direct hit.
tossed up on middle, Smith leans out and defends down the track
on the leg stump this time, Smith plays it out to the leg side quietly.
Kallis is away, drilling a full ball on his toes to mid on.

Smith is off to his most confident start so far in the World Cup. Nathan spears it into the pads and Smith chips it square with aplomb. Guptill at deep backward square leg puts in a dive to stop the boundary.
fired in in the early 90 kphs, on leg stump, Smith drives to mid on for one more
on Kallis' pads, deft clip as he whirs the wrists and gets a single
tossed up on the toes again, Smith drives without timing to mid on
holds the length back to end the over, Smith covers the line. Nathan hasn't got a degree of turn so far.
curling delivery from round the stumps, lands on off as Kallis reaches out to defend
Vettori lands this outside leg, easy pickings for Kallis as he flicks through square leg
searching delivery on leg stump, not much spin but good loop on that one, as Kallis worked the on drive to mid on
shorter and quicker, Kallis stays back and punches into the covers
crowd catch, as Kallis leans into a punchy cover drive and plays it into the turf. On the bounce to cover.
Vettori finishes with another one on the pads and Kallis works it round the corner for a single to end the over
flighted outside off, Kallis leans out and drives against the spin into the covers.
tossed up on leg stump, Smith flicks easily to midwicket. This double spin opening works perfectly for him. He's struggled against the quicks mostly.
again on middle, Smith is well forward as he dabs to the leg side

huge appeal for caught behind, turned down by Aleem Dar, the most magnificent of umpires, and not reviewed. Naughty from the McCullums. Offie landed on the leg stump and turned down the leg side as Kallis missed the glance. Straight off the pad.
Nathan keeps it on leg stump again, Kallis works it with the spin to midwicket
and again, Kallis looks to whip with the spin but finds midwicket
flat on middle and off, Smith stays back and works to short midwicket
fuller on middle and leg, Smith works the wrists to get it away backward of square for a single
top shot to a very good delivery. Vettori again curls the delivery from wide of the crease towards the pads, but there isn't much turn. Kallis stays inside the line and glances expertly for a couple.

majestic from Kallis. We have seen him do this so often in the last 15 years or so. Tossed up by Vettori on off stump, Kallis was out of the crease in a flash and just launched it through the line over long off.

huge lbw appeal, turned down and not reviewed. Kallis charges out again, doesn't get to the pitch as he looks for the straight loft again, and the ball skids along to hit him in front of middle. But the angle was taking it toward leg stump. Or beyond. 2.5 metres rule would have come into play. And this wasn't hitting the middle stump, so it would have been a wasted review. Replays are in, it was only clipping leg. Good call not to review that.
slow and inviting outside off, Kallis lets it go
back of a length and angling across Smith, he confidently gets across and drives to cover
back of a length on the pads, Smith whips backward of square for a single. He's looking good, for a change.
nice delivery, short of a length in the McGrath spot outside off, Kallis shuffles into line and defends
back of a length outside off, Kallis punches into the covers

Southee just learnt just how small the margin of error is when you are bowling to the world's best allrounder. That was not even on leg stump, it was on middle and leg as Kallis skipped inside the line and whipped it away superbly for a boundary through square leg. Top shot.
Southee's over ends as Kallis pushes another single in front of square
flat and a foot outside off, Kallis leaves again.
arm ball, hurries into Kallis on the back foot and he stabs it to the off side
further up outside off, Kallis opens the face as he reaches across and drives through point
fluent drive for a single, Vettori tosses it up on off stump and Kallis goes with the spin along the ground to long off

aha, Smith's first iffy moment in this chase as he charges out of the crease, plays for more spin than there is and squirts an outside edge backward of point as he looks to turn the face of the blade early.
full delivery on middle and leg, Kallis punches past the bowler towards mid on for a single
short of a length and angling across the left hander, Southee is yet to get any swing today. Smith stays back and dabs to third man with an angled face for a single
top-edged but safe. Kallis was clearly late on the pull as Southee digs the bouncer in short and pacy. It did not carry to fine leg though, who was running in.
width outside Kallis' off stump and he thick-edges the cut to third man for a single.

top shot this from Kallis. He's played some stunners in the middle of the edgy moments. Southee again lands one on the pads, this is a very tepid start from him. Kallis again skips inside the line with his shuffle and whips through square leg for four more
Southee gets some inward movement off the seam, but Kallis is in no trouble as he gets behind it and drills the check drive to mid on
over-pitched at friendly pace outside off and Smith drives to mid off for a single
back of a length and cutting into Kallis from outside off, and he chops it away with soft hands, backward of point for a single.
very full and outside leg stump, Smith plays over and around it as he gets it out to mid on
128 kph and it comes off slowly from a length as Smith chops it off the back foot towards point.
Oram cuts out the angle as he gets one to slant in from outside off. Smith punches it back down the track.
flayed away. Oram delivers a 129 kph dolly well outside off and Smith throws the kitchen sink at it, and some utensils to boot. Cracking square cut in front of point. Emphatic.
short of a length, tucking Kallis up as he hops onto the back foot, worked with the angle to square leg for a single
short ball, comes along as very manageable pace and Smith redirects it to deep square leg with a fully-in-control pull shot.
sharp inducker from outside off, Southee wants an lbw, but Kallis, despite getting prone as he shuffles across, gets it away to backward of square leg
over-pitched on off, Smith was looking to drive hard, but seemed to change his mind and just deflect it to midwicket for a single
aha, another Southee bouncer, at 136 kph, and this time Kallis pulls out of the pull shot.
length ball on off to end the over, Kallis presses forward and defends into the off side
Oram slants one in from wide of the crease into middle and leg, Smith squeezes it away towards fine leg for a single
length ball outside off, Kallis chooses to let it go to the keeper
Oram is getting some in swing, sharp and into Kallis who turns it off the hips through backward square leg
full delivery on off, Smith looks completely at ease today, as he drives to mid on for a single
holds the length back even more, Kallis stays on the crease and defends down the track
another inswinger, Kallis covers the line and drives, not with completely good timing, past the bowler for a single
fuller length ball outside off, hinted at shaping away, but kallis drove without problems into the covers
short of a length outside off, Kallis stays back and dabs it down to third man for a single.
short of a length on and around off stump, Smith hangs back and defends into the covers
cramps him for room as it comes in from wide of the crease, Smith steers backward of point for a single
short of a length outside off, Kallis stands back and punches to mid off
137 kph, but it seemed to stop on a length before coming onto the bat. Kallis still kept the drive down, and Southee could not get a hand on it before it crashed into the stumps at the bowler's end.
poor start, gentle flighted loosener well outside off, Smith pounces on it and bangs it through the covers fluently
holds the length back, on middle and leg, Smith works it to the leg side for a single
Woodcock is all over the pace, this one is dangled well down the leg side and Kallis tickles it along to fine leg

whoa where did that come from? Suddenly one jumps up from a length from outside off and goes away. Kallis pulls out like a man taking a towel out of the closet before realising there's a snake hanging onto it.
fuller on middle and off, Kallis plays it back down the track.
loopy delivery outside off, Kallis guides through cover point for a single
short of a length outside off from Oram, Kallis dabs with an angled face to third man for a single

Smith has thrown it away. Another wicket falls against the run of play today. Full and wide outside off from Oram, it was there for the flaying, but Smith had to keep it down. He did not get the front foot across, and hence carved it in the air. How, the substitute, was waiting at a cross between gully and backward point. Nicely taken. Smith threw the kitchen sink at it, but forgot to first unscrew the thing from the wall. Can the Kiwis get back into the game now?
inducker from outside off, AB covers the line and defends to the off side
fuller and wider outside off, AB gets the front foot across and times the square drive well. But there is protection on the edge the circle.
another one short of a length outside off, kind of kept low too. AB crouched and ensured he kept the steer to short third man down.
another runless ball to end the over as AB defends a length ball solidly to point.
tossed up on leg stump, Kallis gets the front foot inside the line and works it backward of square leg for a single
AB is away, tapping a full ball on the toes to midwicket for another single
Woodcock gets a hint of inward drift from outside off, but it lands well outside off as Kallis presses forward into a drive. Guptill dives away at the covers and prevents any runs.
back of a length outside off, Kallis adjusts and defends past slip
Guptill is everywhere, and he always seems to be horizontal. Tossed up outside off, Kallis punches with power into the covers until horizontal Guptill intervenes.
ooh, armer to end the over, AB was forward and just managed to get an inside edge as he played partly down the wrong line.
short of a length outside off, Kallis stays on the crease and plays it out to point
fuller and inviting the drive, Kallis plays it straight to cover with authority
aha, Oram bends one a long way in, Kallis whips backward of square leg even as he seemed to be falling over in an attempt to play the shot. Gets a couple to deep backward square leg
over-pitched outside off, Kallis mistimes the big cover drive and finds the man inside the circle.
length ball on off again, Oram's being quite accurate and Kallis plays him away to the off side carefully
fuller length on off stump, Kallis looks to place the drive to the left of cover by using the wrists, but can't get it away.
that's a full toss outside leg, helped to deep midwicket for four, New Zealand can't afford these freebies
length ball on middle and off, punched down to long-on
on the pads again, tucked towards square leg for an easy single
length ball on the pads, clipped towards midwicket
tossed up and on the pads, batsman attempts a powerful sweep but can't connect properly, ball dribbles to the leg side
short of length outside off, defended to the off side
that one jags in from short of length, gets the inside-edge as AB looks to drive through the off, edges on to the pad
length ball outside off, driven towards backward point
powerful drive from AB, it was overpitched, juicy and wide, cracked towards cover where a diving stop from Guptill saves New Zealand four runs
an inside edge towards mid-on as AB looks to force the ball down the ground
a swinging full toss on offstump to complete the maiden, AB pushes the ball towards cover
short of length ball on middle, worked behind backward point for a single
flighted delivery from Vettori, stops a touch on the batsman, who plays an uppish drive towards mid-off
worked towards midwicket
skates down the track, still doesn't get to the pitch of the ball, gets the ball behind square leg for a single

length ball on middle and off, worked the ball towards point, midway between the inner circle and the boundary, AB de Villiers has to dive to make his ground as the throw is fired in, Mills was the fielder
punched towards point again, an ambled single this time
on middle and off, length ball, blocked off  the back foot
whats a shot that is, a short of length ball outside off, square-driven late by AB, he's a master of that stroke, fantastic timing sends it screaming to the boundary
short of length ball on middle and off, punched uppishly towards point
shortish ball, sits up for AB, who slaps the ball towards deep square leg for a single
slants the ball towards off, Kallis opens the face of the bat to guide the ball behind square for a single
sashays down the track, but the ball is well short of where Kallis is, he adjusts and defends towards the off side
Kallis can do this all day, all to easy to push the ball along the ground to long-off and walk a single
and another simple single, AB gets to the pitch of the ball and sends it to long-off
Kallis abandons the pushed singles for a heave, he charges out and slams it over mid-on, it goes high but not long enough and lands short of the boundary, Nathan McCullum does the fielding
looks for an extravagant drive through the off side but is beaten outside off
pushed towards cover to end the over
AB makes room and tries to carve the first ball past point, but can't beat the fielder

sensational shot from AB, short of length ball heading for middle, AB crashes that through cover after getting a half-step forward, the ball races for four, AB enjoys that and holds the follow through for the cameras
into middle and leg, defended off the back foot
short of length ball outside off, AB gets on the back foot and opens the face to guide it behind backward point, that was 138kmh from Southee

length ball just outside off, Kallis gets forward and looks to drive through the off, but he gets an inside-edge towards mid-on, Kallis was coasting for a single but there is a direct hit from Vettori, third umpire is called for and replays show Kallis is home in time
on middle and leg, pushed off the back foot towards short cover
punches the first ball of the over towards the bowler

flight from Vettori, Kallis sweeps, not very well, ball rolls towards square leg, keeper is off and has his gloves off in a jiffy, throws at the non-striker's end and Kallis would have been in trouble is there was a direct hit, he was a little surprised to see AB racing through for the run
sends the ball through his favourite region, square on the off side, and picks up a couple
slapped towards backward point, where a diving stop keeps the batsmen to one
opens the face to steer the ball towards backward point, no time for a single
punched down the track for a single to retain the strike, Kallis moved towards yet another half-century

jinxed Kallis there, he's gone! perhaps this game isn't going to be one-sided after all, it was a shortish ball, Kallis rocked back and clobbered it, it seemed set to go for a six, but Jacob Oram was lurking at deep midwicket and he plucks a high catch to get a big breakthrough for New Zealand
full and on the pads, pushed towards midwicket for a single
angles this into middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on
stands tall and works this one wide of mid-on for a single
length ball just outside off, Duminy steps forward and drives towards mid-off
on the pads, but gets away with it as Duminy drives that straight to midwicket
tossed up and full round the wicket, driven firmly back to the bowler
similar length, just a little width this time, AB pushes it through cover for a single that takes South Africa halfway to the target
fullish ball is eased towards mid-off by Duminy
on the pads, Duminy tucks this towards midwicket and takes an easy single
on the pads, played a little uppishly towards mid-on
punched back to the bowler, that ends a tight over from McCullum, a tense passage of play this
slants this into middle and leg, defended from the crease by AB
Duminy gets behind the line of a middle-and-leg delivery, blocked back to the bowler
a short ball on middle and leg, Duminy looks to guide it behind square leg, bottom-edges it onto the body, Southee testing out Duminy's well-known weakness against the short ball
a touch overpitched on the pads, Duminy gracefully drives that past midwicket for a single
Shot! outstanding from AB, it was overpitched a touch, and AB barely put any effort behind that on-drive, it was all timing, mid-on has no chance
length ball outside off, AB opens the face to steer the ball towards backward point and pinch a single
dabbed towards point by AB for a strolled single
low full toss just outside off, Duminy comes down the track and punches it past a diving McCullum
gets well forward and defends off the front foot

bowled 'im! New Zealand are in this, they are cock-a-hoop after getting their fourth wicket, Duminy looks to cut a delivery that was coming straight on, he misses, it crashes into middle and off, this game just got a lot more interesting
length ball is defended nervously by du Plessis

South Africa, what are you doing? that famous C-word that makes SA fans bristle is going to be bandied about now, du Plessis works the ball towards midwicket and calls AB through for a sharp single, de Villiers races through and dives but he can't make his ground in time before McCullum whips off the bails, massive moment this,  there has been some top fielding today, and McCullum was lightning in taking off the bails
gets on the back foot and defends
defended towards the off side off the front foot
punched back towards the bowler, nervous times this for SA
a bit of width, du Plessis rocks back and jabs the ball towards point
stifled appeal for every ball from the New Zealanders now, this was a regulation forward defence but even that prompted a shout from the fielders
length ball is blocked off the front foot
Nathan McCullum grunts with the effort as he bowls a length ball, defended by du Plessis, followed by an 'ooh' by Brendon McCullum
on the pads, tucked towards square leg
on the pads again, hit more forcefully towards square leg this time
length ball outside off, pushed off the front foot
overpitched and outside off, crunched towards the bowler, who collects the ball and fires it back at the stumps
a length ball that is sliding down leg, hit on the pad and there is a muted appeal for lbw
length ball on the pads, gets on the back foot and tucks it to square leg
that was going straight on, it was just outside off, too close to cut, Botha barely connects
NZ fielding has been sensational today, and once more there is a diving stop in the cover to cut off any run
length ball outside off, driven towards cover

length ball on off, a wristy shot sends the ball in front of square leg, not sure why South Africa are struggling this badly, Woodcock isn't turning the ball at all, yet South Africa are treating him with the respect they would give someone of Murali's class
on the pads, clipped towards square leg for a single
length ball outside off, a fidgety poke towards backward point
SA batsman jumping onto the backfoot repeatedly to length balls, this time it is defend to the leg side
punched towards cover by du Plessis, another dot ball
length ball on middle and off, batsman shuffles across and plays a wristy shot towards square leg
length ball on middle and off, the batsman stretches well forward and defends
length ball on off, defended towards cover
length ball on middle, pushed towards mid-on, and another risky single is taken, Vettori is having a bit of trouble with his knee so he isn't as quick as most of the other NZ fielders
length ball slanting into off side, blocked off the front foot towards the off side
Brendon McCullum is as excited as a teenager at a Beatles concert, every ball is greeted with a loud 'Oh!', even if the batsman middles it, as he did this time

and another one gone, short of length ball that moved away a touch, Botha plays down the wrong line, he was looking to defend down the  middle stump, but the ball was heading for off, and South Africa are six down
full length ball on middle, defended down the track
every ball seems good enough to get a wicket. Nathan gets one to skid past a nervous poke. South Africa are sinking slowly.
on middle stump, Faf works it with the spin to midwicket
at long last Faf jumps out to the pitch of the ball and drives against the spin to mid off
back of a length outside off, Robin rocks back and hacks into the covers
fired in on the leg stump, Robin gets half forward and defends down the track
curling into leg stump line, Robin leans out to defend into the off side.
Faf jumps out of the crease, and lofts cleanly over the infield. Vacant areas at deep midwicket, that's a clever shot for three runs.

Oram can't hide his glee, he's running around in glee, tip-toeing with a naughty smile on his face. Brendon McCullum is happy as well. Tragedy for Robin Peterson. Back of a length ball angling across him, it may have kept lower than he thought as he went for the slash and got an under edge. Clear noise, and through to Baz. Robin's gone. South Africa's World Cup is coming to an end.
Steyns' away with a boundary. Bit of a gift from Oram, he gets one slanting into the pads and Steyn nudges it along to fine leg
short of a length on middle and off, Steyn gets behind the line and defends down the track
Oram hits the deck and gets one to go away a touch, Steyn pokes it out backward of point for a single.

glorious stroke from Faf, relieves some of the pressure. Oram over-pitches outside off, Faf leans out into the stroke and smokes the cover drive, along the carpet and avoiding the many fielders in the covers.
straighter ball, flat and holding its line as it crosses Steyn, who angles with an opened face towards short third man
full and fast on the pads, Steyn looks to flick but can't get it away
another blockhole ball outside off, Steyn can't do much with it.
length ball in the stumps, Steyn plays with the spin to midwicket
offie on off stump from over the wicket, Steyn works it with the spin to the leg side
finally he gets the single, working a back of length ball off the hips through backward square leg for one
full delivery, slips down the leg side though as Steyn misses the flick.
on off stump, Steyn pushes it out to mid off
short and wide outside off, Steyn waits and whacks the cut backward of point for a single
you can't get anything past Guptill today. Absolutely nothing. Full delivery on off, Faf muscles a cover drive with some power, and an acrobatic Guptill in the covers goes diagonal to parry it.
on leg stump this time, and not much turn as Stayn defends with bat and pad close together.
Steyn's not picking the lack of turn. He swipes outside the line, but the ball holds its trajectory and hits the inside edge
single to end the over, worked off the pads to square leg for one
back of a length on off, defended with the full face.
turning onto the pads, Steyn works it off the pads to the leg side
fired in on off, Steyn pushes into the covers.

a camera moment from Oram. He trotted in, loped forward, swooped and dived ahead in slow motion to take a regulation catch at point. Steyn's demise is a lot like South Africa's tonight. Long, and agonisingly drawn out. Tossed up outside off, Steyn hops out and goes for an airy inside out carve and gets a big outside edge. The ball loops up and comes down, and inevitably Oram gets under it.
flat on middle and off, Morkel gets half forward and defends
fuller still, Morkel gets some timing on the off drive, but finds mid off
over-pitched outside off, Faf can't get under the drive and mistimes it into the covers.
Faf charges out and takes it on the full, but the cover drive is outside edged. And the edge doesn't beat short third man. That kind of day.
full pitched ball outside off, Faf gets some muscle into the square drive and gets it away for a couple to deep point
full pitched on the pads, Faf bunts past mid on for a single.
fired in back of a length on leg stump, Morne manages to play it out to the off side
uppish but safe. Tossed up on the pads, Morne whips it just past midwicket for a single to the deep
aha, Morkel wants to hit this to Jo'burg. Length ball on middle, angling across, Morkel has a humongous swipe to the leg side and misses
short of a length on off stump, Morkel waits on the crease and pushes into the covers
yorker, not the paciest, on off stump and Morkel digs it out to cover point for a tight single. A direct hit from point might have caught him short.

Faf has not thrown in the towel. He's actually played pretty well in the midst of madness. Full toss on middle, he was charging out of the crease, making room to the leg side as he did. He ended up in a good position to bunt it right back past the bowler.
Southee sends down a tight yorker on the toes, Faf can't time the flick as he runs down the track again. Single to midwicket
another yorker that curled away as Morkel looked to drive and got a thick outside edge to deep backward point. And Faf refuses the single. He wants strike.
Vettori sends one in full and wide outside off, Faf can't get bat on the steered dab
yorker on middle, faf is trying really hard to get under it, but he can only hit it back at Vettori
top shot Faf. He's doing his bit here. Jumps out to scramble Vettori's lengths, and takes the ball on the full and slams the on-drive to the left of mid on.
Vettori misfields. Faf drills a full ball back and Vettori lets it through the legs for a single
full and glighted outside off, Morkel decides to leave
another single denied, Morkel stays back and slashes a short ball outside off straight to point
long on is back, and just as well. Faf is playing the on-drive really well now. Again, he skips out and takes a low full toss on the full and gets a single to the deep.
yorker goes awry, full toss a foot outside off, Morkel clears the legs away and has a mighty heave at it. Connects with thin air, and sets off a stiff breeze around the stadium.
top-class bouncer from Southee, sees Morkel is looking for the full ball, Southee knows it and sends him the bumper, Morkel is forced to duck at the last moment.
over-pitched outside off, Morkel carves away past point, makes good contact but there is a sweeper back. This is a very cleverly set Powerplay field
and now to the other man in the outfield. Full delivery on middle and leg, Faf forces it to long on for a single
short of a length from round the stumps, Morkel again tries to chop him away square, but under-edges into the turf.

dropped. Oram's taken a couple of monster catches today, but can't summon his inner Munaf Patel this time. Full toss on the middle and leg line, Faf clubs it right back and Oram can't hold on. He's smiling.

Oram's not smiling any more. Faf is going on and on, and this game is not over. Faf sashays forward to a half volley and launches it out of Mirpur. It lands behind How running back and trying a catch at deep extra cover. New Zealand are sweating now.
he tries to crack one through the covers now as Oram goes wider. Guptill is in the way. Again.
yorker ends up as a full toss on Morkel's pads and he gets a leg bye away to square leg

Faf's gone, and with that, I reckon the last ember of South African hope. Tragedy for the Proteas. Can't blame him for going for another big hit, he had to do this all by himself. It was a full delivery wide outside off and Faf lined it up by moving towards leg stump. He made really solid contact with a cracking sliced cover drive, but Southee was at cover point. It went dead straight to him. Oram has 4. What a game he is having! He so badly wanted to play this World Cup after all those injuries. It's a happy Friday night out for the big man.
length ball on off stump, Tahir gets behind the line with some wobbly footwork and defends
back of a length on off stump, Morkel stays behind the line and pushes into the off side

New Zealand have asphyxiated South Africa's chase, and the end has finally arrived. Morkel charges out, he knows only a miracle could have redeemed this, he got to the pitch and looked to blast an off drive over long off, against the spin. He made good connection, but not good enough. Easy, comfortable catch in the deep. Boy, when are South Africa going to win a World Cup?!
